website_summaries.verdict: Madden NFL 13 trots out the same basic experience one more time, creating an enjoyable game without any major improvements.
pros: Connected Careers offers a healthy variety of ways to playJim Nantz and Phil Simms provide solid commentaryCompetitive play is great funRoster of retired coaches and players brings back fond memories
cons: Pointless Kinect supportLittle difference on the field from previous yearsOld issues are still present

customer_reviews.title: Madden 13 Review
customer_reviews.text: Great game! I like how Infinity Engine excelled at the graphics. I put more than 300 hours plus multiple championships and superbowl wins with different teams. It's hard to stop playing this game because I invested so much time into it. I tried the others and it's not the same. I will be buying this game again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Reviewer 2014

customer_reviews.title: Connected Careers is a joke.
customer_reviews.text: The gameplay was improved with the new engine, but the connected careers gig is really lame. I can't edit my players at all? Really? I've played one full season, did all the crap to get extra XP points. I didn't like it. It took 3 times longer to go through a season. The draft process definately took a step backwards. The whole progressing the players has some potential, but I don't understand how it seems like each player has two different ratings. One for the depth chart, and the other for connected careers. Confusing and just plain terrible to someone who has been paying EA's light bill for years. Trading this garbage in today.
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: Disaster
customer_reviews.text: The game is great, except the new franchise mode has no fantasy draft, no clues as to how fast a player will progress, a new trade screen that takes about 14 hours to use, an unbelievably slow simulation, no importing draft classes, and no editing players. In other words, it is virtually impossible to customize your own team - you must play with official EA rosters. If you are an online player, enjoy the slight upgrade to the gameplay. If you are a franchise mode player, don't buy, as it is gone and there is no playable substitute.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Better than Madden 16
customer_reviews.text: I got this game yesterday and boy o boy did I like it a LOT more than Madden 16! The gameplay of this game is better in my opinion also the presentation is too, the presentation makes you feel like you are playing on CBS. The 1 and only problem is that it is very hard to trade for someone not on the trade block(My brother offered the Seahawks his 1st round pick for their kicker and they declined it🤷‍♂️🤦‍♂️) But other than that I really enjoy the game.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Truly disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: I've played only a few Madden games in my life. I'm not going for full-out realism, but I am going for an experience that invites me back to the game over and over again. Madden 12 did it. Madden 13 did not. It seemed as if the 2013 design made the game a little sloppier, and a little bit more convoluted. The worst is the redesigned kick options (like punts or field goals) where on the XBOX, you need to use the right-stick. What happened to just the simple A button huh? All in all, I traded the sucker in, and feel bad for even pre-ordering this game in the first place. I won't make the same mistake next year.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Nagle

customer_reviews.title: Last Madden I'll ever buy.
customer_reviews.text: I don't even know where to start with this game. Unless you have XBox Live, it's pretty much useless. You can't play a season, or dynasty without it. Granted I do have a Live account, but, I shouldn't have to have that in order to play the game. If you don't have a Live account, you can only play one game at a time. No more offline dynasty. Also, no more Madden Moments, which was a Game Mode I always really enjoyed. Yes, the graphics, and overall game play is pretty decent, but if this is the direction that EA/Microsoft is going to take this game, I'll never buy another year of Madden again.
customer_reviews.author: cherokee0014

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like MADDEN of old
customer_reviews.text: I normally LOVE the MADDEN games. but this one "13" just does not have the feel and play of pre 01-12. Its still a fun game and i play it all the time. but the game modes are all diffrent and took a lot of getting used to. there was a learning curve to say the least. The graphics are A+ and the game face is pretty cool too. Overall its ok For newer players not accustom to the older style this is def a 5 star purchase For us old guard, its still a 5 star game, just not the same. So its 3 stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: John Haas

customer_reviews.title: Fun, especially with a friend
customer_reviews.text: Let me preface this by saying that I do not play many video games. My Xbox gets used a lot more for Netflix than for any games. But, I do like football, so gave this a chance. Compared to the old football games I played in middle school and high school, this is great. They've gotten rid of a lot of the monotonous boring parts and put in some features that actually make the game more fun. The Kinect features are really awesome. And I love playing on Live with friends. All in all, a good way to play a video game that isn't going to take up several hours or an entire day (unless you want it to).

Don't usually buy these religiously on a yearly basis, just as long as EA Sports updates the current NFL rosters, I'm a Happy Camper- otherwise if I have to manually change the rosters, I might as well build myself a Super-Team= LOL Sports games usually have more value when it comes to playability- it usually doesn't get old fast.

customer_reviews.author: Daniel Haney

customer_reviews.title: It was good...
customer_reviews.text: I liked the game overall, I just didn't get into it as I have in the past. The oddities that happened with the new physics was strange and at times funny. I am a casual fan of football in general and have always liked playing the football games but for some reason I threw interceptions all the time. I guess it felt like it was geared more towards hardcore football fans, which I guess is the idea, but as a casual fan, I didn't enjoy it as much as I have in the past. Overall it was fun at times and would say it is an okay game.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B

customer_reviews.title: Design is lacking and online servers very laggy
customer_reviews.text: The on-field gameplay is the best of any Madden series, but they make the rest of the game so frustrating to navigate. I don't mind Connected Careers as it's just a different layout for franchise. But the game has several drawbacks: - Slow loading times navigating menus - Online play laggy and unplayable - Commentary is the most repetitive I have ever heard in a sports title - No live stats as in NBA or MLB 2k Until they fix the online play it is not worth full price. Maybe $40 or less.
customer_reviews.author: Snowbound

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Have been playing the 2011 version of this game series until I just bought this 2013 one. To be honest, the 2011 version is much more enjoyable to play. It seems like the Madden series is regressing instead of progressing. The graphics look worse, and the game play doesn't seem as real (just watch the extremely fake-looking player interactions and tackles.) The game isn't as user friendly or "organic" as past games. More technical and difficult to operate than it should be. Overall, it just seems like this one was given a much smaller budget or wasn't put as much effort in. A decent game, but definitely not worth $60 and arguably not worth the Madden title.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor B.

customer_reviews.title: New  engine,  same game
customer_reviews.text: Much has been made about the new game engine powering Madden 13, but the game feels unfinished to me. Sure the engine can provide some memorable tackles but more often it just does weird and often laughable things. It's extremely common to see your players tripping over each other and falling down after the play is over and just generally wonky behavior. combine that with basically no real improvements in actual game play and you have more of the same in not quite as good of a package.

Without the patch there is no co-op aside of exhibition matches.

customer_reviews.title: Madden 13 - another failed rendition
customer_reviews.text: Too bad EA has no competition in video football - perhaps that would compel them to produce something that doesn't suffer frequent freeze-ups during on-line play. And, again, EA has decided to change the viewing direction for game play - now when on defense you must look through the opposing offense to control your selected player - ridiculous! On kick-offs, the view suddenly switches from mid-field to the receiving end zone, making it even more difficult than it already was to cover kicks. Adding insult to injury, only EA requires an "account" and your email address to play on-line. Someone needs to call the NFL and tell them that EA is not doing their sport any favors.

customer_reviews.title: Instant Regret
customer_reviews.text: I feel as if the wool were pulled over my eyes. For years, going back to college, my wife and I LOVED running through the franchise mode. Season after season, the game was a source of endless fun. I finally purchased Madden 13, assuming one of, if not the cornerstone of the franchise would be there, as if an unwritten law. I was stunned and shocked to see that the feature was simply, and without warning, removed! They may have finally caught up to NFL 2k5 with tackling physics, but I'm now looking to return this game as quickly as possible. I feel better off with 12, and it's outdated rosters.

customer_reviews.title: Not About Franchise
customer_reviews.text: Yeah they got rid of one of the most coveted aspects of the Madden experience, but the largest issue is how they just seem to believe they can ignore the public. This game simply steam rolls the player and their desire, for a product that is more about making money. There are plenty of us Madden faithful that have supported this product through many years (good and bad). But every time we knew Madden was trying to improve, even if it didn't always work. Now this isn't even an attempt to improve for thr player, just to show your dominance as a corporation.

product_meta.title: Madden NFL 13 - Xbox 360
product_meta.description:
Platform:Xbox 360*The DLC (Downloadable Content), Trials/Subscriptions may or may not be included and are not guaranteed to work*

AMAZON.COM


Madden NFL 13 is the 2012 release in Electronic Arts' celebrated American football video game release. Developed around the powerful, all-new Infinity game engine, Madden NFL 13 delivers a more engrossing, complete and realistic gridiron experience than any game before it. Key game features include: presentation reminiscent of national television broadcasts, gameplay improvements such as a new pass-ready system, improved play action, and the all-new read and react defensive AI system, optional Kinect sensor support,* Madden social/play functionality, multiplayer support online and offline, and the ability to build the ultimate franchise as a coach, an NFL superstar, or yourself.

PRESENTATION
Madden NFL 13 delivers world-class presentation with an all-new living front end, dynamic in-game transitions, a live ticker, and drastically improved usability. Every game has the feel of a nationally televised broadcast with CBS Sports commentators Jim Nantz and Phil Simms calling the action from the virtual 3D booth.

GAMEPLAY IMPROVEMENTS
With a completely redesigned passing game, including a new pass-ready system, improved play action, and the all-new read and react defensive AI system that features the most intelligent pass defense to date, Madden NFL 13 achieves greater realism on the virtual gridiron on both sides of the ball. In addition, Madden NFL 13 delivers physics you can feel. Powered by the all-new Infinity game engine, true player impact and authentic momentum transfer ensure that no two plays ever look or feel the same.

Tackle the most intelligent pass defense in a Madden game to date.
View larger The all-new Infinity game engine provides physics that you can feel.
View larger Multiplayer support both online and in local play allows you to always share the game with friends.
View larger CONNECTED CAREERS
Live the NFL dream - whenever you want, wherever you want in a fully interactive, social, and connected online experience. Create your personal legacy or relive that of an all-time legend's as you build the ultimate franchise as a coach, an NFL superstar, or yourself. Manage your team from your console, the web, or mobile phone in a 24/7 world as NFL insiders and experts analyze, praise, and criticize every move along the way.

INFINITY ENGINE
With Physics You Can Feel,Madden NFL 13delivers Next Generation gameplay today. Powered by the all-new Infinity Engine, true player impact and authentic momentum transfer ensure that no two plays ever look or feel the same.

XBOX 360 KINECT
Control the line of scrimmage using just your voice. Both on defense and offense, Kinect on Xbox 360 gives you full control over all your pre-snap adjustments, audibles, and personnel, immersing you into the NFL like never before!

MADDEN ULTIMATE TEAM
Madden NFL 13 Ultimate Team is the definitive way to experience virtual card collecting with new content and updates that mirror exciting NFL events throughout the entire year.

SOCIAL AND MOBILE INTEGRATION
Stay connected and broadcast your football glory to all your friends with seamless Facebook and Twitter integration, including easy post-game status updates and Tweets.

MULTIPLAYER
Enjoy the drama of every aspect of NFL play with friends through multiplayer support, both online and offline. The Xbox 360 version of Madden NFL 13 supports 1-4 players locally, and 2-6 players online on Xbox LIVE.

AUDIO
Madden NFL 13 delivers a superb audio experience that faithfully replicates NFL Sundays with CBS Sports' Jim Nantz and Phil Simms calling the action, QB cadences, authentic sound effects and actual on-field player chatter, all provided by NFL Films, and a fully-scored orchestral theme that conveys the emotion and excitement of professional football.
